intro: Erigeron khorassanicus, commonly known as the Karakorum fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Erigeron khorassanicus is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
